messages.subject: CRY FOR HELP
messages.body:
Dear Friend,
I am Mrs. Sese-seko widow of the late President Mobutu Sese-seko of Zaire now known as DemocraticRepublic of Congo(DRC). I move to write this letter, this was in confidence considering my present circumstance and situation. I escaped along with my Husband and two of other of my son AHMED and Michael out of the Democratic Republic Of Congo (DRC) to the Dakar, Senegal were my family and I settled, while we later moved from Morocco where my Husband later died of cancer disease.
However due to the Situation we decided to change most of my husband billions of dollars deposited in Swissbank and other countries into other forms of money coded for safe deposit because the new Head of state of (DR) Mr. Laurent Kabila has made arrangement to the Swiss Government and other European Countries to freeze all my late husband treasures deposited in some European Countries.
Hence my children and I decided laying low in Africa to study the situation till when things get better, like now that President Kabila is dead and the son taking over (Joseph Kabila). Once of my late husband's Chateaux in Southern France was confiscated by the French government, and such I had to change my identity so that my investment will not be traced and confiscated. I have Deposited the Sum of Twenty Eight Million United States Dollars(US$28,000,00.) with a Security Company in Dakar Senegal, for safekeeping. The fund are coded to prevent them from knowing the content.
What I want you to do is to indicate your interest that you will assist us by receiving the money on our behalf. Acknowledge this message, so that I can introduce you to my son (AHMED) who has the modalities for the claim of the said fund. I want you to assist in investing this money, but I will not want my identity revealed. I will also like to buy properties and stock in multinational companies to engage in other safe and non-speculative investment. May I at this point emphasise the high level of confidentiality, which this business demands, and hope you will not betray the trust and confidence, which I response in you. In conclusion, if you want to assist us, my son shall put you in the picture of the business, tell you were the funds are currently being maintained and also discuss other modalities including remuneration for your service.
For this reason kindly furnish us your contact information, that is your personal telephone and fax number for confidential purpose and acknowledge receipt of this mail.
Do contact me through this email address.
aida2004am@walla.com
Best regards
Mrs AIDE Seseseko
messages.raw:

Date: Thu, 7 Oct 2004

messages.subject: CRY FOR HELP
messages.body:
Dear Ura R Sole
Thank you for your mail. I think it is necessary to explain to you again in more clearer terms t situation with me. I ran to Senegal for safety immediately after my Husband were brutally murdered. When I came to Senegal, we had no means of initial survival, so we went to United Nations Refugee camp here in Dakar-Senegal and declared asylum with hope to go to the finance house to claim my Husband deposit and start a new life.
Unfortunetely, when we went to the finance house, they said that we am already a refugee and their law does not permit release of such deposit to a refugee who has no international passport or any other established identification. Then they advised me to look for some to stand for me. I contacted you because I want to leave in your country and therefore want our family money to go to your country and in your custody. we have gone to the the finance house to tell them that we have got someone who is my trustee/representative for the claim of the deposit.
So you can now contact the finance house and ask them if late Mobutu Sese-seko has a deposit with them and if Ahmed seko is the son who has right to inherit the deposit as the next of kin. If it is true, that we have appointed you to be my trustee/representative to claim the deposit on my behalf for investment in your country. Ask them to tell you the procedures and requirements for the release of the deposit to you on my behalf. The name of finance house is SAGAM FINACEC COMPANY DAKAR
SENEGAL
The email address is: sagam_company@email.com
TEL/FAX 00221 4444 587 452
The name of the man I met is mr mike smith He is their director of foreign operations/wire transfers Sincerely yours, pls brother call my son ahmed with this number 00221 668 03 99 pls we can not go out from the camp ok and we do not have money to call you today pls
Mrs Aida Seseseko

Date: Sat, 9 Oct 2004

(Aida's made her first mistake; her story is different in this e-mail to that of her original mass mailing. Her husband was "brutally murdered" and did not die of "cancer disease" after all... We'll let this one go... Mike Smith is the name of a UK DJ/TV presenter who was married to another UK TV presenter, Sarah Greene. This explains the next e-mail...)

messages.body:
Mrs Aida,
I am the secretary to Ura R Sole, who I understand you have been in contact with regarding a financial transaction. Ms. Sole is currently away for a business meeting and is due back in the office on Wednesday. I have been put in charge of her e-mail until she returns. She asked me to pass on her good wishes to you at what must be a difficult time. I pass on her good wishes to you at what must be a difficult time.
Having read through your last e-mail, may I take this opportunity to ask what it is you're wibbering on about? I would be grateful if you could explain in a single short paragraph so as not to make me loose the will to live.
I look forward to hearing from you.
Kind regards,
Bobby Shaftoe, secretary to Ura R Sole

messages.subject: Going to Western Union today
messages.body:
Hello Granny Aida,
I could never forget about you given your situation - how could you even suggest such a thing my sweet? Please do not call me a liar - that is very unfair. I know that sometimes when we are having problems in our lives, we say things that we don't mean. Writing your name as Rose when it is actually Aida, for example.
Aida, my sweet, what are you doing at the security company? I thought you were stuck at the refugee camp and were unable to leave?
Anyway, Bobby Shaftoe is going to the Western Union office today to pay your money. Look after yourself, ma'am.
Good day,
Ura R Sole

Hello Gypsy Aida,
I sent Bobby Shaftoe along to the Western Union office yesterday but they refused to accept his payment. He

Please suggest another way that I can get the payment to you, gypsy woman.
Write soon big lady.

messages.body:
Hello Aida,
Quit ya moaning, sweet. The bank is at fault, not me. I went to see them today to give them a good wigging.
Anyway, it turns out the payment has been put on hold because they regard it as suspicious. 
Apparently, people abroad have been using bank money transfer as a means of defrauding people in our own country.
The bank have said that they are willing to transfer the money, but only if they have proof that the transaction is secure. Anyway, what they require is:
- Your ORIGINAL passport, birth certificate or driver's licence. Alternatively, you may supply a topless photograph.
- Your car keys
- Payment from yourself of $100 US
I think these requirements sound unreasonable, but apparently we'll get the things back as soon as the transfer has taken place.
I pointed out to them that you were unlikely to have a car but would they listen? So what I will do is give them my own keys. Also, I imagine it will be difficult for you to pay $100 at this time. What I will do is pay half the fee myself and ask you for just $50. Write back soon, Aida.
Ura R Sole

messages.body:
Hello granny,
I have just returned from my period of illness. Bobby has kept me up to date with the latest developments. As you are aware, Western Union have been rather arsey with us so unless you can make other arrangements, we will have to travel out and see you. How does that sound, poppet?
Thank you for the attachment you sent me. I generally wouldn't touch attachments sent by you with a barge poll, but when I saw it was a picture of you late father (or at least his hands) I decided to make an exception. That is a great party trick! How did he manage to flick through a wad of dollar (or should I say daller) bills like that? He must have got annoyed when looking at books, however, having to read the same words every time he turned the page...
We would like a full size image of your late father doing his party piece.
Good day
Ura R Sole

What is a 'Nigrian 419'? I dont understand, love. We can meet your son, but you have given no indication of
where in London we might find him. We want to see you as well as your son. Why will you not provide a map?
Do you want my help or not, sweet? You say you want the money, but you make it extremely difficult for me
to give it to you.
Write soon,
Ura R Sole

messages.body:
Hello Aida,
Blinking flip woman, why do you always try and blame me for your actions? Had you told me where in London your son had been staying, the money would have been paid by now.
What is your son doing spending his money on holidays to London when his poor mother is stuck in a rufugee camp with a dirty water supply? Did he not think that it might have been nice to use the money to help his mum, the one who brought him into this world, raised him and made him into the man he is today? Ungrateful sod.
I have explained to you that our Western Union office will not accept the payment, sugar. Our only option now is for me to meet you in Senegal to give you the money personally. Please, I need a map showing how to get to Mugu Road. Where is it in relation to the nearest airport?
Write soon, big lady.
Ura R Sole

messages.body:
Hello Granny,
Isn't the trunk box currently in London? What are you wanting to send it to Spain for, love? Bloody hell, that trunk box is becoming more well travelled than Michael Palin. Sending it to Spain will be added expense and hassle for both of us. It makes sense to keep it in London so I can get to it easily, gypsy Aida. I'm sure the security company will be happy to see me in London.
I still wish to meet up with you in Senegal at some stage, big lady. You keep harping on about me giving you a phone number, but you have yet to supply me with a map showing how to get to the refugee camp in Mugu Road. Our taxi driver needs to know the route from the airport. Gimmee a map and I'll give you a phone number.
Write soon - we need to get things moving.
Love and kisses
Ura R Sole

URA R SOLE
